meanings.definition: (verb) to make something look tacky or unattractive
meanings.sent1: She kept naffing up her outfit with mismatched accessories.
meanings.sent2: The cheap decorations naffing up the party.
meanings.sent3: He naffed up the room with clashing colors.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti naffed up the clean wall.
meanings.sent5: The old paint job naffed up the beauty of the house.

meanings.sent1: That naffing shirt is so outdated.
meanings.sent2: The naffing curtains don't match anything in the room.
meanings.sent3: Her naffing hairstyle was a fashion disaster.
meanings.sent4: The naffing furniture made the room look drab.
meanings.sent5: The naffing artwork was not appealing at all.

meanings.definition: (adverb) used for emphasis or to express annoyance
meanings.sent1: I am naffing tired of waiting for the bus.
meanings.sent2: She naffing forgot her keys again.
meanings.sent3: He naffing complained about the weather all day.
meanings.sent5: The food was naffing delicious at the restaurant.
